name: unsupportable
content:
unsupportable adjective
(NOT TRUE)
Add to word list
Add to word list
An unsupportable argument, statement, etc. cannot be shown to be true with evidence: The report is totally without credibility and is filled with wild, unsupportable claims. I do not like to base my opinion on such an unsupportable argument.
More examplesFewer examplesIt would be unsupportable for the government to sign up to an agreement and then fail to honour its obligations.Making such unsupportable statements is a weak substitute for strong arguments backed up with undeniable evidence.Wealth accumulation generally leads to an unsupportable level of exploitation.

unsupportable adjective
(NOT ACCEPTABLE)
If something bad is unsupportable, you are not able to accept that it should continue: In the end, the cost of the wars became unsupportable. These are unsupportable rates of population growth.
